title: NBC’s Taken Prequel Series Will Show You How Bryan Mills Got His “Very Particular Set of Skills”
content:
Of course taking a hit flick and rejiggering it for TV is nothing new. This season there’s Rush Hour and Limitless on CBS, Galaxy Quest in development for Amazon, Minority Report set for this season on Fox with Urban Cowboy and Fatal Attraction in the works, The Notebook in development at The CW, Uncle Buck on ABC, Scream and Teen Wolf on MTV, and that’s just the tip of the iceberg. 

Hit shows such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Parenthood and In the Heat of the Night and M*A*S*H were all based on films. And of course, not ever translation is a success. In the late 80s and early 1990s we got TV shows based on Working Girl, Dirty Dancing and Baby Boom and they were quickly canceled. Beeson’s had some success in turning his movies into TV shows with La Femme Nikita (which had two TV versions, La Femme Nikita with Peta Wilson and Nikita with Maggie Q) and Transporter. 

Will you tune into the Taken series? 

(E! and NBC are both part of the NBCUniversal family.) 

Click here to read full story »
